name: MobiCom
summary: A mobile prepaid recharge application built using Spring Boot and Angular
points: Facilitated users to browse and purchase plans with dummy payment methods, while offering statistics on their current plan and past recharges via dashboard interfaces
Implemented authentication, mail service and scheduler tasks for seamless user experience and reliability
Utilized Lombok for code efficiency and reduced boilerplate code, Spring Data JPA with MySQL for ensuring efficient data access and management and Bootstrap for minimal responsive UI

name: Whatsapp Clone
summary: A fullstack replica of Whatsapp with its primary features
points: Constructed using technologies like React.js, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Node.js, and Express.js
Implemented real-time communication with Socket.io and integrated ZegoCloud, a platform with API services for enhanced video/voice call support
Utilized Prisma, PostgreSQL and Firebase for database management and secure Google authentication
Incorporated features like text, image, video, and audio messaging, coupled with real-time status updates for seamless communication

name: Netflix Clone
summary: A replica of Netflix built using React.js and Firebase
points: Replicated Netflix's home, sign-in and browse pages
Implemented the compound components pattern and external libraries like styled-components and Fuse.js
Used Firebase's database for data fetching and authentication for accessing the data
Set up custom hooks for persistent login and data retrieval

name: FaceRecog
summary: A face recognition based attendance system using Python with its framework and libraries
points: Developed a python application using the open source face recognition library
Integrated it to a web application using the Flask framework
Designed a user-friendly UI for the web app using HTML, CSS and JavaScript

name: Daily Weather API - Web App
summary: A weather forecast application based on OpenWeatherMap API built using React.js
points: Implemented a UI to fetch current weather data using the React.js framework
Employment of storage formats like JSON and XML for data retrieved using search queries
Acquired knowledge about the OpenWeatherMap API and data retrieving

name: TaskNest
summary: A task management application built using Next.js, Express.js, and MongoDB
points: Implemented CRUD operations for tasks, allowing users to add, update, delete, and mark tasks as completed while ensuring they are unique to users
Integrated JWT-based user authentication for secure access and user management
Deployed the fullstack application on Vercel for seamless access and scalability

name: ThoughtLane
summary: A blogging platform built using Next.js, Express.js and MongoDB
points: Implemented features for posting, updating, and deleting blogs
Added functionality to comment on and like posts, enhancing user interaction
Provided the ability to view posts from different users, fostering a community experience
Integrated JWT-based user authentication for secure access and user management
Deployed the fullstack application on Vercel for reliable hosting and performance

name: SkyCast
summary: A weather forecast application based on Zomato's WeatherUnion API built using Next.js
points: Developed a UI for daily weather lookups, fetching details such as temperature, humidity, wind speed, and rain accumulation
Leveraged the Free Weather API provided by Zomato, called WeatherUnion, to retrieve weather information for localities in various Indian cities
Ensured a responsive and user-friendly interface for seamless weather updates
Deployed the web-app on Vercel for optimal performance and easy accessibility
